sts row 2 chain 1 single_crochet in bottom of same st work 2 single_crochet in each st around slip_stitch in first chain to close round 12 sts row 3 chain 1 work 2 single_crochet in next st *single_crochet in next st work 2 single_crochet in next st * repeat from * to * around slip_stitch in first chain to close round 18 sts row 4 chain 1 single_crochet in next st work 2 single_crochet in next st *single_crochet in each of next 2 sts work 2 single_crochet in next st * repeat around join 2ndcolor in the last stitch with cc slip_stitch in first chain to close round 24 sts row 5 chain 1 single_crochet in each of next 2 sts work 2 single_crochet in next st *single_crochet in each of next 3 sts work 2 single_crochet in next st * repeat from * to * around slip_stitch in first chain to close round 30 sts row 6 chain 1 single_crochet in each of next 3 sts work 2 single_crochet in next st *single_crochet in each of next 4 sts work 2 single_crochet in next st * repeat from * to * around slip_stitch in first chain to close round fasten_off weave in ends 36 sts joining join in order using the appropriate chart above using green join yarn in any stitch chain 1 single_crochet in same stitch single_crochet 17 times more around the first circle *hold the next circle close to the first and single_crochet into any stitch on the second circle single_crochet 17 more times around this circle * repeat from * to * with the remaining 19 circles with the last circle single_crochet around 18 more stitches and then single_crochet into the same stitch as the joining please note there will be 2 scs in the single_crochet on each circle where the 2 circles are joined fasten_off and weave in ends felting the north scarf place your north scarf into a zippered pillowcase or a pillowcase closed with a strong rubber band fill your washer with hot water a squirt of dish soap and 1/2-cup of baking soda add your encased scarf to the washer along with a few pairs of old jeans and/or a few pairs of tennis shoes set your washer to the longest normal wash cycle possible and let er rip stop your machine and check on your scarf every 5-8 minutes to make sure it is felting properly and not sticking together use an old broom handle to lift the pillowcase out of the washer to check the scarf be careful the water is very hot if your scarf has not fully felted by the time your wash cycle has ended turn back the cycle before it drains the tub and then let it run again never
